lead_paragraph: ZIEGLER--Jean-Claude, 68. A graduate of Linsly Military Institute '64 and Georgetown University '68, he had a long career as an executive at Y&R. He is survived by his mother, Simone Ziegler, his sister Anne-Marie Ziegler and his niece Anne-Nicole Hanus. He was a man of great character beloved by friends for his caring nature, intellect and unique charm. A consummate New Yorker, he also maintained strong family ties to France. His casual cosmopolitan spirit brightened his every conversation, with a Gallic temper held in reserve for the deserving few. A passionate collector of beautiful historical objects his presence in those circles will be deeply missed. He served as secretary to the Art Glass Forum/New York and was a member and frequent visitor to the Metropolitan Museum, Carnegie Hall and the Metropolitan Opera. As a generous advocate for the less fortunate and animal rights we suggest donations to the Humane Society of the United States or Friends of the High Line, in lieu of flowers. Memorial service at "The Riverside" on Amsterdam Ave. and 76th St., on June 10th at 3pm with a reception following (RSVP) and burial in Westport on the 11th. 1/3
